tasks.task: Safely operate a combine harvester.
subtasks: Install all safety guards correctly.
Lower header unit and secure combine before parking.
Familiarize with safety decals and features.
Ensure hazard lights are on when driving on roads.
Use turn signals appropriately; avoid rear discharge lights on public roads.
Adjust seat and controls for comfortable operation.
Practice rear steering and stay alert when operating.
Avoid distractions from additional passengers.
Use horn when moving to alert others.
Be cautious during turns, especially on slopes.
Check and adjust ballast weights as needed.
Properly maintain and support headers during maintenance.
Follow shutdown procedures for maintenance.
Coordinate with other operators during unloading.
Never enter a grain tank while the engine is running.
Have a second person present during maintenance.
Check and maintain fire extinguishers.
Regularly clean the engine compartment and moving parts.

tasks.task: Acknowledge the importance of safety in combine operations.
subtasks: Recognize the business depends on harvesting; do not ignore safety.
Follow safety instructions in the operators' manual.

tasks.task: Understand combine operation hazards.
subtasks: Appreciate the potential for injury and equipment damage.
Avoid sharp turns and other risky maneuvers.

tasks.task: Safely operate a combine harvester
Safely operate a combine.
Safely operate a combine harvester.
Acknowledge the importance of safety in combine operations.
Then, the practical MAINTASK would be to "Operate the combine safely," with the above safety subtasks.
Acknowledge the importance of safety in combine operations.
Physically operate the combine safely.
Adopt a safety-first approach while operating a combine.
Recognize combine operation hazards and follow safety procedures.
Recognize combine operation hazards and follow safety procedures.
Hence the two MAINTASKs.
Safely operate a combine harvester.
Understand Combine operation hazards and the prerequisites for safe operation.
Safely operate a combine harvester.
subtasks: Install all safety guards correctly.
Lower header unit and secure combine before parking.
Familiarize with safety decals and features.
Ensure hazard lights are on when driving on roads.
Use turn signals appropriately; avoid rear discharge lights on public roads.
Adjust seat and controls for comfortable operation.
Practice rear steering and stay alert when operating.
Avoid additional passengers to prevent distraction.
Use the Combine horn to signal moving away.
Be cautious during turns, especially on slopes.
Check and adjust ballast weights as needed.
Properly maintain and support headers during maintenance.
Follow shutdown procedures for maintenance.
Coordinate with other operators during unloading.
Never enter the grain tank while the engine is running.
Have another person present when doing maintenance.
Check and maintain fire extinguishers.
Regularly clean the engine compartment and moving parts.

tasks.task: Acknowledge the importance of safety in combine operations.
subtasks: Recognize that the success of the farming business depends on harvesting, making safety crucial.
Follow safety instructions clearly outlined in the Combine Operators’ Manual.
Ensure that all safety relief procedures and shields are operating correctly.
